verses.roman:
ghātayiṣya ihānītau
kāla-kalpena hastinā
yadi muktau tato mallair
ghātaye vaidyutopamaiḥ

synonyms: ghātayiṣye—I shall have Them killed; iha—here; ānītau—brought; kāla-kalpena—like death itself; hastinā—by the elephant; yadi—if; muktau—They go free; tataḥ—then; mallaiḥ—by wrestlers; ghātaye—I will have killed; vaidyuta—lightning; upamaiḥ—just like.
translation: After you bring Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma, I will have Them killed by my elephant, who is as powerful as death itself. And if by chance They escape from him, I will have Them killed by my wrestlers, who are as strong as lightning.
